author: Richard Wheatstone
title: Matalan murderer jailed for life after stabbing window dresser and new boyfriend to death in obsessive knife plot
text:
News Matalan murderer jailed for life after stabbing window dresser and new boyfriend to death in obsessive knife plot Saunders - who was jailed for life at Cardiff Crown Court today - lay in wait for Zoe Morgan and Lee Simmons to arrive at work as weeks of bitter planning reached its deadly climax Share Lee Simmons and Zoe Morgan were stabbed to death outside Matalan in Cardiff city centre Share   
An obsessive killer who researched and plotted the murders of his ex-girlfriend and new partner for weeks before knifing them to death in a city centre street has been jailed for life. 
Andrew Saunders lay in wait for Zoe Morgan, 21, and Lee Simmons, 33, to arrive at work at Matalan on Queen Street in Cardiff city centre on September 28 last year. 
Just hours earlier Saunders had purchased two kitchen knives and a pair of latex gloves from Morrisons as his evil plan entered its final stage. 
After discovering his former partner - a window dresser at the store - was dating a colleague he had launched into a vengeful spiral of abusive text messages and blood-thirsty Google searches. 
He text Miss Morgan "you're a f***ing whore for getting with him" and "this is so unfair so tell me where he lives and I’ll f***ing torch his house" while also claiming "I still love you". Read More Andrew Saunders was jailed for life today (Photo: WALES NEWS SERVICE) The killer became obsessed with his former partner and her new boyfriend (Photo: Wales News Service) 
Meanwhile, he was searching terms such as “16 steps to kill someone and not get caught”, "how to knife someone's neck" and “how can a car be rigged to explode when started?”. 
Saunders left his home at 4.41am and was seen waiting by phone boxes near Matalan from around 5.30am. 
When the couple arrived for work at 5.50am, Saunders pulled an eight-inch knife from his rucksack and began mercilessly stabbing Mr Simmons in the back and chest. 
Mr Simmons shouted "please", "help, help, help" and "stop, stop". 
Miss Morgan bravely tried to pull the killer off her boyfriend as Saunders screamed "I'm coming for you next you b****." Read More Zoe Morgan, who was killed in Cardiff (Photo: Facebook) Lee Simmons and Zoe Morgan, who were killed in Cardiff (Photo: Facebook) 
Mr Simmons managed to get to his knees but Saunders punched him back to the ground, from where the 33-year-old didn't move again. 
As Miss Morgan ran towards a nearby Boots store, Saunders produced a second knife - measuring 10 inches - from his bag and chased after her. 
She was stabbed in the throat before Saunders "casually" gathered his weapons from the floor and walked away. 
Moments later he phoned his mum for 11 minutes before arriving back at his family home in Castleton, near Newport at 6.10am. (Photo: Wales News Service) (Photo: Wales News Service) 
At 6.17am he text his dad: "Thanks for being a pathetic, useless father. Just killed two people. Cheers." 
His sister called 999, reporting that Saunders had arrived home with blood on him and had a gun, saying that he had killed Miss Morgan and Mr Simmons. 
At 6.30am Saunders posted "F***" on Facebook, later adding: "Product of society." 
Police attended his home and arrested Saunders, who told them: "I'm sorry, you know sometimes you just snap," before asking "are they both dead?". (Photo: Wales News) (Photo: Wales News) 
In custody, Saunders asked: "Are they both dead? I just want to know for peace of mind." 
A post-mortem examination found Mr Simmons and Miss Morgan both suffered eight stab wounds. 
Sentencing, Justice Nicola Davies said: "Without warning, you approached Lee Simmons from behind, grabbed him and stabbed him in the back. 
"You were responsible for the fatal injuries which led to the deaths of Lee Simmons and Zoe Morgan. 
"They had their whole lives ahead of them. In a sustained and brutal attack, you ended those lives and took away the futures of Zoe Morgan and Lee Simmons." Like us on Facebook
